top_stories.title: Understanding Financial Reasoning in AI: A Multimodal Benchmark and Error Learning Approach
top_stories.description:
arXiv:2506.06282v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Effective financial reasoning demands not only textual understanding but also the ability to interpret complex visual data such as charts, tables, and trend graphs. This paper introduces a new benchmark designed to evaluate how well AI models - especially large language and multimodal models - reason in finance-specific contexts. Covering 3,200 expert-level question-answer pairs across 15 core financial topics, the benchmark integrates both textua
top_stories.author: Shuangyan Deng, Haizhou Peng, Jiachen Xu, Chunhou Liu, Ciprian Doru Giurcuaneanu, Jiamou Liu

top_stories.title: Unreal Patterns
top_stories.description:
arXiv:2506.06284v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: This paper introduces a framework for representing information about entities that do not exist or may never exist, such as those involving fictional entities, blueprints, simulations, and future scenarios. Traditional approaches that introduce "dummy instances" or rely on modal logic are criticized, and a proposal is defended in which such cases are modeled using the intersections of actual types rather than specific non existent tokens. top_stories.author: John Beverley, Jim Logan
